chilled adjective
(COLD)
Add to word list
Add to word list
made cold, usually by being put in a fridge: Serve this delicious starter with a very chilled white wine. I like to drink the juice in a chilled glass. See also
chill cabinet
More examplesFewer examplesTry this young, fruity red slightly chilled for a refreshing treat.Serve in a very chilled martini glass.

chilled adjective
(RELAXED)
informal relaxed, not getting worried or angry about anything: Me, I'm feeling pretty chilled. You're a very chilled person and people feel relaxed around you. Synonym
chill
More examplesFewer examplesHe was very chilled about everything and never put me under pressure.The music sets a very chilled mood.
